column4: hello! can you tell my what to do if after installing Ubuntu I have text "grub rescue>" ?
grub failed to install properly. which is sort of rare. but not unheard of.  whats your level of linux experience?
exactly how did you do that install?  from within windows? booted a live cd/usb? or how exactly.

I had Ubuntu, then I installed W7, then grub dissapeared, then I reinstalled Ubuntu from USB, but in the end of installation there was written "An attempt to install additional packages from the CD failed". This is stupid, because I wasnt using CD, but USB
if windows whiped out the bootloader., you just had to reinstall grub not the whole s.
ive seen some cases where the installer gets confused and thinks theres a cd..
I tried that in the beginning, but didn't help
I had almost clean Ubuntu install, so it didn't matter a lot
ive never had that erorr when installing from usb. so cant really suggest a fix for it.
there is already bug reported on this CD issue https://bugs.launchpad.net/ubuntu/+source/ubiquity/+bug/658865
how do you think, could this grub error be because of CD bug?
could be. it did a partitial install and dident complete.. so yes. i whoudl think so
try installing from cd. i guess would be the easists work around.
As I understand from this link, I just have to move some files in my USB to different location.
pavcontrol perhaps. or some of the other pa* tools
the #ubuntuone channel may help better with that.
